title: What is the proper form for responding to a summons for suit by a credit card company in los angeles county
question: I have to respond to a summons from Citibank, regarding a credit card. The summons says the response must be in proper legal form. What is proper legal form? Is there a specific form I need to use?
question_tags: Business contracts,Bankruptcy,Credit,Debt,Bankruptcy and debt,Arbitration,Lawsuits and disputes,Summons and complaint
answers:
If you are served with a Summons and Complaint, you should first record the date and manner in which you were served, and then retain a lawyer to file a timely response on your behalf. In most instances, for Superior Court lawsuits, you have 30 days from the date of personal service to respond to the Summons and Complaint.

In the event you absolutely cannot afford an attorney to defend you, you can represent yourself "in pro per". You would file either an Answer or a General Denial, and pay the first appearance filing fee.

The form for the Answer is (Judicial Council Form PLD-C-010):

http://www.courtinfo.ca.gov/forms/fillable/pldc010.pdf

The form for the General Denial is (Judicial Council Form PLD-050):

http://www.courtinfo.ca.gov/forms/fillable/pld050.pdf

If you cannot afford the first appearance filing fee, you may apply for a fee waiver. See:

http://www.courtinfo.ca.gov/selfhelp/lowcost/getready.htm#fees

There are several options in addition to the ones mentioned.
1. Demurrer
2. Motion to Quash Service of Summons
3. Assert Affirmative defenses
4. Motion to Strike
5. Cross-Complaint
6. Motion to Compel Arbitration

You may be able to use General Denial (Form PLD-050)

You are correct, the "proper legal form" is not very clear, but you have not provided enough information to know what is the proper form for defense of your case. For instance, is the amount over $25,000? Is the complaint verified? How long ago does the complaint state the debt was last paid or the contract breached? Have you had any disputes with the bank on the account balance? Have you been harassed since defaulting on this debt?

You may want to check my web site to explore your options when sued on a debt, before you attempt to represent yourself. To many people end up with frustration and a judgment against them when they try being their own attorney in a court case on a debt. I link to my blog about this, below.
